briefing.opening: Good morning. I will now begin the climate briefing for January 28, 2026.

sections.title: ğŸ”´ The Doomsday Clock and Intensifying Climate Crisis Warnings
sections.content: According to news released today, the Doomsday Clock has been moved to 85 seconds to midnight due to threats from nuclear weapons, climate change, and artificial intelligence, indicating that humanity faces an unprecedented crisis [2, 4, 17, 92, 96, 107, 109, 110, 111, 112, 118]. Globally, global warming is intensifying both heat and cold phenomena, with the likelihood of heatwaves increasing fivefold in Australia, and experts warning that New Zealand could experience more fatal landslides due to intense storms caused by the climate crisis [91, 94, 95, 97, 117, 119]. These climate changes are also directly impacting the agricultural sector, causing native beetles to turn into pests, displacing farmers from their livelihoods, and leading to severe problems across ecosystems and the economy, such as rising coffee bean prices and changes in honey quality [9, 11, 19, 99, 116]. The signs of the climate crisis, manifesting through various pathways, demonstrate the urgent need for immediate and decisive human response.

sections.title: ğŸ‡°ğŸ‡· Domestic Efforts for Climate Change Adaptation and Carbon Neutrality Implementation
sections.content: Domestically, multifaceted efforts are actively underway to adapt to climate change and achieve carbon neutrality. Yeosu City is preparing to host the UNFCCC Climate Week in 2026, while Wando-gun and Ulleung-gun are actively implementing their respective climate crisis response strategies and third-phase climate crisis adaptation measures, striving to strengthen regional climate resilience [5, 7, 14, 16]. Notably, 'blue carbon' in the deep sea of the East Sea is gaining attention as a carbon neutrality game-changer, possessing nine times stronger carbon absorption capacity than the West Sea tidal flats [21], and K-water is expanding opportunities for technology demonstration by joining the 'Net Zero Challenge X' [22]. Furthermore, the Ministry of SMEs and Startups, the Ministry of Climate, and the Ministry of Trade, Industry and Energy are providing carbon neutrality support programs in one place through 'Joint On-site Briefings,' and various local governments are accelerating the transition to a carbon-neutral society by promoting diverse policies such as operating citizen participation groups for carbon neutrality, distributing electric vehicles, revitalizing wooden architecture, and creating carbon-neutral forests [25, 26, 27, 28, 29, 31, 32, 36, 39, 40, 41, 42, 46, 48, 52, 53]. In the industrial sector, active participation from companies continues, with HD Hyundai Construction Equipment recognizing 2050 carbon neutrality as 'survival, not just a slogan' and promoting the expansion of renewable energy and eco-friendly products, while Samsung Heavy Industries and others are developing innovative technologies for maritime carbon neutrality [38, 43, 44, 47, 50, 51].

sections.title: ğŸŒ± Accelerating Renewable Energy Transition and Global Cooperation
sections.content: The transition to renewable energy is gaining strong momentum both domestically and internationally. Domestically, KEPCO KPS and Jeonnam Development Corporation are responding to the major energy transition through renewable energy cooperation [54], while Hyundai Engineering & Construction and Korea Midland Power are accelerating their entry into the North American renewable energy market by holding a groundbreaking ceremony for 'LUCY,' a large-scale solar power development project in the U.S. [55, 57, 62, 65, 75, 79, 82, 83, 84, 90]. At the government level, renewable energy has been selected as the first investment target for the National Growth Fund, and President Lee has announced plans to designate the southwestern coast as an RE100 special zone to intensively foster renewable energy, thereby strengthening policy support [64, 76, 78, 88, 89]. Efforts by local governments and public institutions are also continuing, with North Chungcheong Province declaring an expansion of renewable energy supply and Korea Rural Community Corporation commencing a feasibility study for Saemangeum tidal power generation [70, 85, 87]. Internationally, global cooperation and investment are actively unfolding, with Khanh Hoa City in Vietnam setting a goal to become a renewable energy 'capital,' and GS Engineering & Construction making its first foray into the Indian renewable energy market by completing a solar power complex [35, 69, 74, 80, 81]. While corporate demand for renewable energy use is exploding, analyses suggest that Korea's energy system has reached a critical point, raising the need for flexible support and institutional improvements [66, 71].

sections.title: ğŸŒ International Climate Response and Policy Challenges
sections.content: The international community is focusing on strengthening information transparency and accountability for climate change response. The European Union has supported the 'Climate Information Integrity Initiative,' emphasizing its necessity for effective climate action, and SUPRO successfully concluded a 'Climate Change Response Strategy' workshop in Uzbekistan, demonstrating ongoing international cooperation and capacity-building efforts [1, 3, 18]. Meanwhile, in Maine, USA, legal and policy pressure regarding climate responsibility is intensifying, with a bill introduced to hold corporations accountable for climate change and proposals to fine fossil fuel companies being considered [93, 103]. However, there are also concerning movements counteracting climate change response, such as the Trump administration's orders to remove climate change and Native American-related information from national parks and accelerate oil and gas drilling in national forests [101, 102, 108, 113]. Furthermore, a report indicating that Liberia's climate adaptation efforts are hampered by governance failures and donor dependence highlights the severity of climate vulnerability and structural issues in developing countries [114]. Thus, while the international community is exploring various approaches to climate change response, it faces gaps between political will and actual implementation, as well as new challenges.

briefing.closing: Today's briefing has highlighted the reality of the globally intensifying climate crisis, underscored by the Doomsday Clock's warning, while also reminding us of the importance of ongoing carbon neutrality and renewable energy transition efforts both domestically and internationally. It is imperative that these crises and efforts are balanced as we strive towards a sustainable future. This concludes today's climate briefing.
